content: I'm reviewing https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/pull/7255. The code looks good to me. But, I'm not familiar to Windows, so I don't know if it makes sense to allow wparam and lparam. Does anyone know if this is reasonable?

They are used by direct callbacks from window handlers (See Microsoft doc). These names are also used in practice, at least I have done that, and I've seen other code do the same. (When they are working on such a low level) -> :+1: from me
Side note: They are more often written as wParam and lParam which a capital P I'm not sure if that is important in this context?
I'll second that. They're the only names I've ever seen used for message handlers on windows.
Thanks for your comments! It looks reasonable!
